title: Primary Pet Care - Veterinary Teaching Hospital
description: Routine and preventive care for dogs and cats of all ages, including wellness plans, serving as your pet's primary care veterinarian.
cleaned_text: service Primary Pet Care animal typescompanion The community practice service provides quality routine and wellness care for dogs and cats of all ages, serving as your pet's primary care veterinarian. As a student-run service, faculty clinicians supervise and support third- and fourth-year veterinary students as they gain experience in primary care and client communication. Preventive care - including regular exams, vaccinations, and health screenings - can help your pet live a longer, healthier life and reduce the long-term costs of veterinary care. We offer wellness plans for dogs and cats as cost-effective options for pet owners seeking to maintain the health of their pet. Services - Annual checkups - Spaying and neutering - Vaccinations - Dental care - Preventive health care - Senior care - Parasite control - Treatment for minor injuries and illnesses - Behavioral wellness counseling - Euthanasia - Weight management animal health [view all »](https://vetmedbiosci.colostate.edu/vth/animal-health/?tag=primary-care) Find advice and information about taking care of your animal.
